dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the first summer of the 21st century. Wendy, Wichita, Talia, Donald, Adam, Jasper, and Pixel were to spend it as camp counselors. The world would be changed forever. Kind of. Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seven characters are now seen situated atop an array of large rocks surrounding a flagpole. They have all been straight-jacketed into the same identity-squelching light blue shirt and all hold a glossy booklet that has a cute counselor couple and a cuter Camper joyously roasting hot dogs on its cover. A HARSH MALE VOICE sneers from a loudspeaker atop a small structure nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A collection of individuals separated from regular society eventually becomes something more than a collection of individuals separated from regular society. It becomes  one mammoth living organism. Different traits of different people feeding off and flowing into each other--the naive and the perverse, the brutal and the sweet, the overconfident and the overwhelmed-- all coming together to form one singularly special whole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Campers, welcome to Camp Bleeding Squaw!  I'm Big Chief Oberon. Fun.  I like it. You think I don't?  I do. But Fun without structure is chaos and chaos is not fun--Now everybody rip off their band-aid!  All shapes and sizes of campers (and counselors) reach to their bandaged body parts and tear away with the same AAH sound. Red, Blue, Green, and Purple dots are revealed upo each character's skin.  OBERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really not believe in God?  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, there's a lot of things I don't believe in... Definitely not in conversation mode, Wichita burrows back into Wendy but she winds away again.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else don't you believe in?  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking while kissing.  Thinking he has suavely defused the situation, Wichita sw yet again. Alas, Wendy grimly sits all the way up.  WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think you're just into nihilism for nihilism's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the point of nihilism; you know, what other sake is there?  You're not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita exhales through his teeth and rises all the way u to look out into the night. He turns to Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in organized religion, organized school, and organized summer camp. I don't believe cigarette advertisements have ever caused a single teenager to take up smoking.  Premature death sells itself. I find Catcher in the Rye a bit whiny, and much prefer Franny and Zooey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you say you don't believe in organized summer camp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timetables. Workbooklets. Minus four for the blue team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not used to such combat, Wendy wobbles to her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll agree to a degree of overregimentation here at Bleeding Squaw, but kids need to be guided through well-established rituals of teamwork and verbal reinforcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is one frightening sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, that's the way summer camp has worked for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, that's the way summer camp has not worked for years. The old coming-of-age rituals are just so...expired. You think you can just throw an arm around these kids' shoulders and say, "I know how you feel. Life is kind of tough.  All that I ask is that you be the best you can be." How do you tell my tubby, whiny loser Todd to be the best you can be, when the best he can be is probably pretty shitty.  Wendy, you're an idealist and that's wonderful, but an idealist without reality is like a great dancer without legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prowling before the cabins, a glowering Oberon bangs batteries into a powerful flashlight and thunders it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a grin, Adam watches Oberon rumble past the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita, you are so dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Losing his smile, Adam sits down and nudges a sleeping Bedwetter Ted awake with his boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about waking you, Ted...but changing your sleep patterns is key to avoiding...your problem. Or so I've read. It takes time, but I know you can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely uncozy, Wichita and Wendy sit stiffly upright on the staircase landing, an endless space between them.  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is it, anybody you don't agree about everything with can't be your friend... WENDY (Wendyesque shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iunno.  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Iunno." I'm really beginning to hate that word of yours. I'm sorry for sounding hostile, but I'm not sorry for... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. Don't be sorry for your thoughts. They make me...react. I don't know...all I know is that I can't go through another summer where I almost did something.  WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you have another opening, Slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ] (comic mock-panic)                                     ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, ugh, everything about you is refreshing and the kids love you...Shit, um, your eyes are like sapphires on a moonlit desert and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ] (laughing)                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... Wendy and Wichita outstretch their bodies and delicately crane their necks for a kiss...when suddenly, before they connect, it begins to rain. Wichita snorts a smile.  WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, your God really doesn't want us to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, too bad for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a clumsy attempt at passion that comes across as even more passionate because of its clumsiness, a rising Wendy struggles off her shirt. Wichita effortlessly peels off h and also stands. They crush into each other's arms and ea other's lips, waltzing off the side of the staircase, disappearing into the darkness of the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon blusters forward through the wet wilderness, the r inflaming-rather-than-dampening his adrenaline.  OBERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not against the occasional camp romance, but...I can feel it...Nocturnal Activities. Little rapists and their little whores...Who goes there?  He raises his mighty flashlight to...Sheila, the Sleepwal in the middle of another eerie somnambulistic trek. Obero sighs, then readjusts his beam...as the Sleepwalker shockingly/obliviously drifts by Wichita and Wendy clawin each other on the forest floor.  Oberon blinks. Oberon howls. Oberon gets hit by lightning

dialogues.text: Over black, revelry is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A painted fingernail presses off the familiar revelry tap Wendy is revealed to be situated in Oberon's office, wear his head-set. Her enthusiasm seems a bit forced.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise and Shine, campers and counselors.  Today, unhappiness is not an option.  Mess Hall. Nine minutes. Please.  Wendy removes the head-set with a sigh. As narration kick in, she drifts over to the office cot where a dazed, scra bearded Oberon lies. Wendy begins feeding him oatmeal.  SMOOTH NARRATOR (V.O.)                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course after I was hit by lightning, things around the camp changed...but not as much one would think. At least not right away...Oh. Yes. I'm the narrator. My voice is difficult to recognize when I'm not shouting.  Anyway, I used my freak accident as an excuse to kick back and contemplate my life. As well as everyone else's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy is aggressively marking up some official paperwork. She then rises from the desk to vociferously supervise a line of campers making wallets. She reaches the window wh she pulls on the head-set, sticks out her head, and blows the whistle-- commencing an obstacle course going on outs OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the trauma of having her first significant sexual experience interrupted by her camp director's electrocution, Wendy threw herself into her work and my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita charges up the rockage of a small mountain-hill-t thing. The image repeats itself over and over--each time Wichita is more sweaty, gasping, sneering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita threw himself into himself. The rules forbid anyone from the climbing the camp's mountain. It, of course, became Wichita's favorite activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now highly uncatatonic, Oberon felines from the door of h office structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something deep inside me told me that, despite their retreat into Denial, Wichita and Wendy were still very fond of each other. The fact that I snuck out every night and read their diaries greatly helped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon sits in a lotus position before a small campfire, reading from Wendy's diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE OF WENDY (V.O.)                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since the night of the Evil Weirdness, I find it painful to even look at him. Only you, dear diary, know just how much he has changed me and how much I feel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon lowers Wendy's girly-girl diary with one hand and raises up Wichita's scruffy journal with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE OF WICHITA (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I even like Wendy; I only know that I love her. Wendy's the only truly surprising person I've ever met.  Why won't she talk to me?  Why won't I talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon looks to his watch, kicks dirt on the fire, then t back off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy twitches in restless slumber.  OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The would-be lovers were in pain. Their cabinmates were not much help... Pixel (in a bizarre new haircut) tinkerbells over from he side of the room and predatorily curls beside sleeping be Wendy on her bed.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Pixel's fist does a gopher rumble beneath Wendy's T-shirt As if withstanding torture, Wendy hangs tough.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you just do this for shock value. It's not shocking.  PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did pretending to be bored become a sign of superiority?  Are you mad at me for giving the cabin new haircuts or are you just still miserably pining for Wichita's lightning rod?  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, what time is it?  I have to go feed Big Chief Oberon...You're right, I miss him. Wichita, that is.  I really want to be with him, but I can't bring myself to--Are you a lesbian or are you... PIXEL

dialogues.text: I didn't realize I had to declare a major.  WENDY  (to Pixel's hand)

dialogues.text: Why do you even like me?  Confronted with a real response, Pixel withdraws her hand and unwinds up and over to her own bed. PIXEL

dialogues.text: You remind me of me when I was...I guess I was never like you. So cute. So questioning.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a nai-ive little... PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.  Wendy fumes as the Endlessly Muttering Girl appears in th doorway, wearing the new Pixelesque haircut.  MUTTERING GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-lost-my-barrette. One-time-I-lost- a-magnetic-puzzle-piece-We-thought- my-little-brother-ate-it.  PIXEL (to watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that note, my morning swim... Wendy sighs as Pixel scampers off. The girls of the cabin all awaken with the same kooky haircut (a severe, petite braid dangling about the temple.) MUTTERING GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We-had-to-go-through-his-poop-with- a-kitchen-knife-for-a-week. My- favorite-food-is...

dialogues.text: Head down in depression, Wendy leads a single-file centip of her robed campers away from the showers. Wichita, head down as well, leads a line of his camperstoward the showe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being over eighteen, the counselors assumed all love is shit. It was the campers who were most disillusioned by the fall of Wichita and Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two human trains are about to collide when Wendy and Wichita look up. Without verbal acknowledgement, they glu readjust and continue their head-down trek. The boys and girls look from Wendy to Wichita in despair.

dialogues.text: At even the best camps, the fear  and excitement of the opening weeks gives way to dull routine, but after finding and losing the thrill of romance, the organism that was Camp Bleeding Squaw seem to wither and die faster than usual.  The image of Wendy vibrating atop the chair, leading a ch repeats itself.  WENDY

dialogues.text: Hey campers, how about a morning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: All this ennui culminated into the deadly-dull, Day 20, halfway-mark non-event known as Parents Day.

dialogues.text: After the parents bailed, I decided to check out the little notebooks we gave the campers at the start of the session. Good stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe those are the people I was homesick for...I'm really going to savor my remaining days here at camp and only do exciting stuff like the plan to get Wichita and Wendy back together. Tonight's secret camper meeting about the Day 21 mission went really good, I mean, well.

dialogues.text: GIRLS VOICE FROM DIARY (V.O.)                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just so neat to see them flirting and pretending to be arguing with each other. It was like watching Titanic without the boat.  That's why I'm so happy everything's going to come together on Day 21...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon smiles, then looks to his watch. He kicks out the fire and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flag reading DAY 21 hits the top of the flagpole. Wendy is revealed to be pulling it, sadly mumbling her familiar flag raising song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita watches Wendy walk away from the flagpole way in the distance. He turns to see Eric slide off his top bunk to chat up his pal Stanley in the bunk below.  ERIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thanks, it was nothing... WICHITA  (to watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Guitar music accompanies Eric's pumped trek. He spurts fr some trees and stops dead at the sound of a splash. Pixel is unwinding in the water, luxuriating in her ritualistic skinny-dip. A traumatized (in the best sense) expression  is frozen upon Eric's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, I don't. My God, I have no idea what you feel like... Wendy rack-focuses to the view of a bee pollen-bingeing u a nearby flower. She ferally crawls over and squeezes the flower and the bee, launching into a therapeutic scream.  The boy wipes away his tears, giggling at Wendy, as she shuffles to the edge of the mini-mountain, raising her st palm in the air.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this time talking down to the kids, talking around the kids. No more!  No distance between me and the campers, me and the pain. Yes, yes, the pain is the key!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: continues to threateningly sizzle across a fuse.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BY TALIA AND DONALD
dialogues.text: A tensing up Donald waits for an opening with Talia.  TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the kid says, "Just because something's dead doesn't mean I can't play with it..." DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in all, I'd rather be in India. I find their culture to be so... Talia's eyes widen. Donald and the nearby campers cower.  TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, you're making your big move, aren't you, Retarded Marshmallow Head?  And you've been coached by the best. I mean, of course, let's pair off the two geeks!  How convenient for everyone.  Talia can't possibly have any standards!  All of you can go to hell!  Talia tears down the hill. A concerned Hayley calls out.  HAYLEY

dialogues.text: Talia, don't go!  TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha-at?  What is it?  HAYLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.  Blood starts to cascade from Hayley's shorts. As the near campers freak away, Talia jolts toward her.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: continues to rave, stung hand in air, back to the viewer. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took something as simple as a  bee sting to remind me that a part of myself will always be a camper. You have to be hurt in order to heal! Today is the first day I can truly call myself Counselor!  Wendy pivots around, her face has spookily swelled up. Th surrounding children immediately explode into watching-a- monster-movie, finger-pointing wails of fear and amusemen

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: wobbles to the ground in mortification. Hearing a sizzlin noise, he turns to see Billy's lit fuse blazing toward a Frog covered with taped firecrackers.  The disgusting sounds of the thankfully unseen explosion are thrown into the mountaintop mix. Donald staggers Pvt. Ryan-style, sprinkled with frog's blood.  Some counselors are huddled in a nearby trench. They watc Troublemaker Billy fall to the ground, laughing. JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, on behalf of the sensitive, peace loving counselors, you have our permission to kill him. Make it look like an accident. Or don't.

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: stands staring out the other edge of the mountain. His ba turned to all the ferocious activity. The soundtrack goes silent for Oberon's narration. OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much like a little boy who throws sand at the girl in the sandbox because he likes her, Wichita had helped turn the mountain into a rumbling volcano that had almost given Wendy a nervous breakdown.  A good time was had, but it was now time to move on. To start to take responsibility. To deal with the implications of the photograph on Wendy's wall... Sounds of chaos come back. Wichita finally turns and tank forward, making sharp scans to the pockets of anarchy aro him. Darkening clouds. Traumatized campers. The blood-sta statue of Donald. The wailing wake around a froglike crat Talia helping hemorrhaging Hayley down the hill. Laughing Billy.  Zombie Mutant Wendy.  Wichita exchanges nods with a rather familiar girl. The rather familiar girl goes into the throes of a very famil epileptic fit immediately sobering everyone.  However, the creature that will not die, the monstrously swollen Wendy continues to hobble forward.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I think I forgot to remember that I'm allergic to bee stings.  Thunder ripples the air. Wendy faints. Wichita slides to catch her in a picture-perfect pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pounds outside. Her head bloated to an almost sci-fi degree, Wendy moans away on a cot. Wichita is by her side surrounded by some of the other counselors.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Trying to rip open a tampon, Talia is crouched before a standing, shivering Hayley. Both are crying.  TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew, that wasn't a period. That was an exclamation mark. You know, Hayley, behind every great woman is a great first menstruation anecdote.  HAYLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so... TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is...this is...a very special moment... Talia and Hayley look to each other, and without stopping the flow of their tears, break into a cathartic laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita and Talia accidentally emerge together from the infirmary. They grudgingly acknowledge one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's okay. What about yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you care...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's right, Wichita, you like her more than you like me so I want her to die. Oh, but hey, thanks for passing Donald my way. I need the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.text: Well, you're not going to have to worry about Donald anymore...

dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ] (ashen)                                                ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.text: KINDLY OLD GROCER                                  ]

dialogues.text: DONALD                                             ]

dialogues.text: Thank you, Walter. Double my usual supply. You know, the babes are starting to realize camp is half- over...I don't have to explain the effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Howdy Pouty.  DONALD

Tell the girl you've got to go do something, leave her view, take way too long until she is worried that you're not coming back. Just as she starts feeling awful, you come up from behind and touch her neck... DONALD  (smiling in admiration)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the prince of the darkness.  WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.text: Yeah. I should put all my shit in a book and then throw away the book... DONALD

dialogues.text: The funny thing about this Talia thing is I wasn't even really that...The person I really like-- I probably shouldn't be admitting this... WICHITA  (breaking from trance)

dialogues.text: I'm in the picture on Wendy's wall. Niagara Falls. Family trip. Little Wendy foreground. Me background. What are the odds on that one?  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, that's...wow.  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell her...it's, it's too major...Jesus, I'm starting to believe in God and what's worse I think I like the guy. The lightning bolt was just a test, right?  Wendy and I--we're meant to be. I'm right, right?  I have to see her... DONALD (deflated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say Hi for me.  Donald stands to watch Wichita and Eric exit, then glance to his campers. One of them, in Donaldish glasses, paces back and forth, staring at a scrap of paper.  DONALD

dialogues.text: What is it, Cosmo?  COSMO, THE DONALDISH CAMPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...this girl...gave me this note...she wants to meet by  the creek tonight...I don't know.  Donald launches down and grabs Cosmo by the shoulders.  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camp Eberhardt. Anne Wilson, lovely Anne Wilson. She was the only camper to have a lifeguard's license so  she was the only one allowed to take out a canoe without supervision.  She asked me to come with her for  a post-bonfire spin around the lake and I said no. I was young, I was nervous, I didn't really like canoes-- I said no. If I would have gone on that canoe, I'd be a different  person, I know it. Successful,  happy, assertive.  I'd be a nearsighted Wichita. You think you're a kid so your decisions don't matter now.  They do. They all do. COSMO, THE DONALDISH CAMPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I'll go to the dumb lake. But only if you do "Retard goes to the Movies."

dialogues.text: Todd stares down at his feet, waiting for camp to end. Wichita takes a kamikaze sitting position beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ] (comically perfunctory)                                ]

dialogues.text: Hello, Todd. What are you doing outside the infirmary?

dialogues.text: TODD                                               ]

dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.text: Whuh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TODD                                               ]

dialogues.text: You asked me why I was here, didn't you?  Geez!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You know, Todd, no one cares whether you live or die. Don't get me wrong, it's the same for everybody. Now it's a sad thing that nobody cares if you die--but then if you're dead, who cares that nobody cares. Now the nobody cares if you live part is great. It means you can come up with any idea and quietly burrow it into the world. You may fail a few times and other people might say negative things, but other people are basically lame and they never put up much of a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TODD                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, is that speech in the camp workbooklet..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd, you gotta stop taking everything so seriously. You have to have a sense of humor about life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TODD                                               ]

dialogues.text: But what if it's not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita gulps at Todd's persistent humanity. He starts to pat Todd on the back, but wisely freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some gum?

dialogues.text: A radio is playing "Oh, my Unforgettable Summer Love." Th monstrously swollen Wendy, half-awake, murmurs affectingl along with the song. Wichita is revealed standing in the doorway watching her. He briefly murmurs along, too. His ruggedly casual look has smoothed into one of a tamed tig WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.text: Would have been cooler if I had died. In the throes of an eloquent delirium, Wendy, almost comically, tries to rise up on the cot, but can't.  WENDY

dialogues.text: I have to get up. Still more to do. That boy hates Asian people. That girl thinks she gave her Mom cancer by dropping a plate on her hand. Her daddy touches her. His daddy never touches him. It would have been cooler if I'd died.  WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.text: Wendy, I'll come back later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does every ten year old know what they want to be when they grow up, but then as you actually grow up, you forget every--The girls are big on "Veterinarian" this year-- I think it could be the "ballerina" of this century. WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're seriously wonderful.  Wendy starts to feel a little self-conscious, touching he hair....and then her warped visage.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...You have to get out of here. I'm...having a bad face day. Don't look at me... (a warm beat)                                          ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jasper told me what you did. Carrying me down the mountain as fast as you could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only dropped you twice... They pause to inhale the intoxicating romantic tension.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this the time where one of us says something deeply offensive to the other one...We're just so different.  WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? WENDY  (trying to be flippant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why should we let our actual personalities get in the way of us falling in love?  WICHITA  (trying not to be flippant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd was out there blocking the entrance. You would have been proud of me...My suit of armor is starting to come off. Not all of it, but enough to walk around... WENDY

dialogues.text: And you'll be happy to know I'm going to drop my Snow White and the Seventy Dwarves act...Not all of it, but... WICHITA

dialogues.text: I was thinking...if we could mesh my way of thinking with your way of thinking, we could really do some great counseling. It's all about the evolution of the species, we can improve... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Don't say I love you, too. I hate that--"love you, too."  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. But it doesn't put me in too great a position... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you... Wichita brings his head down upon Wendy's mutated one for a kiss.  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're beautiful.  WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.text: Thank you, my love. The kids on the other side of the divider let loose with  a huge ream of laughter. Wendy happily-grouchily chastise WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should leave. You probably need your rest.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.  Wendy suddenly throws back the sheets and projects out of the bed. Wichita chuckles and gives breathless chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This moment of passion turns into the sight of a FULL MOO complemented by the HOWL of an animal. The viewer's viewp DRIFTS DOWN to see that the howl comes from a wild-haired OBERON, seen from the back, in a mountain man frock.

dialogues.text: HAYLEY                                             ]

dialogues.text: SHEILA THE SLEEPWALK GIRL                          ]

dialogues.text: Thanks, Talia...Why are you so nice to me?  TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I so--That's new--The way  I figure it is if I can get through to just one camper...then I'm a pretty incompetent counselor.  (with warmth)                                          ]

dialogues.text: Don't get caught. I'll deny everything.

dialogues.text: Sheila the Sleepwalk girl is doing a zombie meander befor the Boys cabins. She suddenly breaks character to wave fo her cabinmates and a co-ed assortment of other campers.

dialogues.text: Donald flings open his door to make a glaring appraisal o his snoozing campers. He growls suspiciously, then reclos the door. The campers leap out of their fake slumber, whi out the stolen magazine, and flick on a flashlight.  VOYEUR BOY ONE

dialogues.text: Whoa--I don't get why people protest pornography. They must not have seen this issue.  VOYEUR BOY TWO                                     ]

dialogues.text: Nobody seems to be having much fun... VOYEUR BOY ONE

dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.text: I'm still on anti-biotics, I really shouldn't be caffeining...Gosh, I've had a lot of daydreams about losing my virginity. Never one like this. For one, I wasn't a mutant. Secondly, I...What are you thinking?  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swelling is gonna go down, right?  Wendy giggles. Wichita gently kisses her.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you allowed to do it more than once a night?  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been known to happen.  Wichita and Wendy curl into an embrace. The viewer's viewpoint clambers even further up the hill to where the deranged raggedy man OBERON starkly stands watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON (V.O.)                                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute. Was I ever that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god...intercourse.  HAYLEY

dialogues.text: No way...Move over, Ted.  DOROTHY, THE CRUSH GIRL                            ]

dialogues.text: HAYLEY                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYLEY                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back...back....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBNOXIOUS ADAM CAMPER IN RED CAP                   ]

dialogues.text: Hey, let us impressionable minds have a turn... AMBER, THE LOVELORN GIRL                           ] (crying in corner)                                     ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OTHER CAMPERS                                  ] ("shaddup")                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ick.  STANLEY                                            ]

dialogues.text: One has to wonder if this dramatic change in the relationship of Wendy and Wichita will affect a change in the camp as a whole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC                                               ]

dialogues.text: Stanley, don't even try to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STANLEY                                            ]

dialogues.text: Stanley finally-viciously lets off a THX fart. The camper screech and abandon the telescope, barreling down a ladde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fleeing campers giggle and pant in excitement, madly dashing away from the mess hall, into the forest.  Eric i good-naturedly pounding on Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man Stanley, Wichita and Wendy, sitting in a tree, F-U-C-K-I-N-G. And we missed it--thanks to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBNOXIOUS ADAM CAMPER IN RED CAP                   ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Sheila, did looking through that telescope give you any ideas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEILA THE SLEEPWALKER                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The priesthood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMBER, THE LOVELORN GIRL                           ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so wrong if two people are in love or just really feel like it-- Ooh, lightning bugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backtracking to reasonable innocence, the varied campers all laugh and shove each other trying to capture the near dots of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayley and Bedwetter Ted hang back a bit, sweetly nervous around each other. A strange muffled noise can be vaguely heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEDWETTER TED                                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, pretty interesting day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYLEY                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too interesting. I think I liked things better when--what's that noise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troublemaker Billy is wailing as loud as a gagged person can.  Hence the strange noise. His arms are tied around a tree. A Tennis racquet is pressed against his bare chest by one Adamesque camper, while others, using Brillo pads, severely scrape skin poking out. Adam observes.  ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called "Pink waffle"--perhaps  before your time--Brillo pad scraped against the skin popping out from  a pressed down tennis racquet. Okay, that's enough!  (a chuckle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only kidding. More.  The Brilloing gets fiercer. The muffled moans get louder. Pixel suddenly appears, pushing everyone out of the way. Tennis racquet batted away, Billy's stomach indeed resemb a pink waffle. Adam's Henchmen tear the boy away with the PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadist!  I can't believe I thought you could change--This is your idea  of discipline?  You're a monster.  That kid is going to be traumatized for... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About three days. I'm a monster. He's a monster. Actually, we're both just guys. I don't expect you to understand that I... Surprising Adam, the viewer, and herself, Pixel unzips Ad pants and reaches her hand inside. She determinedly strok and Adam helplessly quivers.  PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really, keep talking, I ree-ally want to hear what you have to say, you're just so eloquent... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you...don't stop...why?  PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Why?" If I asked questions like that, I'd never make love-"love"-- Damn you, Damn this, damnit! Pixel and Adam tug at each other's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wiping off his sweat with his shirt, a euphoric Adam emer from the woods behind his cabin. He scans a half-awake Bedwetter Ted crunched upright against a tree stump with a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEDWETTER TED                                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Adam...I'm sorry...I've...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: been waiting for everyone else to snooze then sneaking out here. You piss and no one will find out--but you're usually too uncomfortable to even sleep. Then you crawl back before we wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEDWETTER TED                                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ] (a beat)                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wild guess...come on, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam hefts Ted up and compassionately steadies him toward the cabin. The viewer's viewpoint rises to take in OBERON lumbering across the roof like a warped Santa Claus. His narration slithers over the following visions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only now that I was detached from it, could I see how dazzling and alive a summer camp could be. Can you blame me for wanting to experiment, to test and to prod the organism, to want to take it to the next extreme...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON's hands snatch a Playstation from a knapsack and another one out from underneath a pillow. He also clings up a pile of comic books poking out through a trunk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a shelf above Wendy's sleeping head, OBERON's hand t out a pristine copy of the happy-happy Counselor workbook

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many workbooklets, many playstations, as well as whistles drugs (medicinal and otherwise), car keys, candy bars, ce phone and power books are heaved into a massive, dug-out hole.  Oberon's beloved stopwatch is maraschino-ed atop t pile. Dirt is heaved over everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON kicks open the door to his ex-office. He takes a delicious pause before laying siege to the immaculate lai of efficiency. OBERON violently tips a bookcase, hurls papers, shreds his cardboard timetable. He then rips out the camp's ham radio sending the film into black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The campers stagger the center of the camp, silently howl their heads off. The counselors help some breathe into inhalers.  Oberon's voice soothes the soundtrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The initial reaction to my actions, especially the burying-the-toys maneuver, was less than superb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, Wichita, and the other counselors suspiciously encircle the "sleeping" Oberon. They turn around, walk a couple paces, then spin back hoping to catch him moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tensions were raised and certain suspicions were aroused...but it wasn't long before the counselors realized the succulent freedom that lay before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counselors survey the damage, the destroyed communications equipment and the spilled bookage, with boggled expressions that are not necessarily unhappy. Don lifts up the ripped-up cardboard timetable and broadly gr The other counselors, even ex-fascists Wendy and Adam, gr as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Dali watches, campers are strategically splayed abou a forest clearing. A deer delicately clumps around them. The campers simultaneously rise up out of their stupor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon the rest of the camp let go and went with the utopian flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lake is placid and untouched. Suddenly, the entire ca counselors and campers, boisterously plow into the frame and into the water with their clothes on to splash and sh in giddy release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Jasper tip the humungous homemade scoreboard int a huge bonfire as the rest of the camp cheers. The camper jut forward to fling their colored headbands into the fla OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every camp, in its closing weeks, must cut loose from the regimentation of its early stages.  Every camp has to find a way to reinvent itself in a more casual, free-er form....Bleeding Squaw just went a bit further. I can't take all the credit--there was a much deeper cause of our anarchy than my cut-the-camp- off-from-civilization mischief...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of skin on skin. Indecipherable body parts. Lip biting cl ups. Operatic music on the soundtrack. OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex, of course. Don't worry, only four people were actually having it. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the operatic music continues, Pixel splashes/meditates in the throes of her morning skinny dip.  Eric again stares out from the woods, completely bewitche The viewer's viewpoint pulls out to reveal that Eric is surrounded by practically every other male child in the c all looking forward with the same life-will-never-be-the- same gaping mouth.  OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the whole idea of it, the scent of it, seemed to insinuate itself into everything like a lush fog...and  a grotesque oil spill.  Pixel does a somersault in the water, catching a glimpse of the army of young voyeurs. She bursts back up. The boy are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crush-on-Jasper Dorothy snips a hefty lock of a napping-i the-forest Jasper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemingly chanting along with the operatic music, a very pagan Dorothy puts the hair in an altar covered with sket of Jasper. Her friends help out in the bizarre ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the center of camp's grass, resembling a 60's love-in, every male camper gives a massage to every female camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operatic music cuts off. With comically intentional stiffness, Wichita approaches Wendy at her cafeteria tabl WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Counselor Wendy, I need assistance in finding that important...thingie in the storage room. WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, why didn't you say something earlier... Holding in laughter, Wendy and Wichita solemnly move off from the table toward a storage room at the back of the M hall.  Most of the campers and counselors subtly stop  speaking and eating to behold them as the operatic music  creeps back on. OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As always, everything revolved around Wendy and Wichita. They were the plant on the classroom windowsill, fed and watered by enthusiastic teachers and children. A special pan is made across the unrequited lovers Donald Jasper (big patch of hair missing at his temple), and Pix who sighs down to a shockingly relaxed Adam dozing on her lap.  They all sadly blink as Wendy and Wichita animatedl unlock the storage door and disappear inside.  OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so much fun to watch it grow and grow...but these classroom plants always have a way of getting too  big...beyond control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita naughtily backs Wendy into the sizable storage ro She gleefully half-fends off his frisky prods beneath her blouse and down her shorts.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think we're fooling anyone?  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think I care?  WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're bad... Wendy surrenders into a kiss. The couple crushes back aga a wood table.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STORAGE ROOM--ANOTHER DAY
dialogues.text: With no tentative giggling foreplay whatsoever, Wichita a Wendy hungrily bash through the storage room door and immediately launch into each other. They do a Postman-Alw Rings-Twice collapse up atop the table and begin clawing  each other's clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: INT. STORAGE ROOM--YET ANOTHER DAY
dialogues.text: Passion down to a clinical science, Wendy and Wichita swi but calmly enter the storage room. With military precisio Wendy removes her shorts, lies back on the table, and lif her tennis shoed feet into the air. Wichita removes his s and fiddles with his pants. They converse as if they were playing Scrabble.  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got a little poison oak and started screaming for assisted suicide.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice. Her father died in that TWA flight the government shot  down...You know I'm going to be in the city next week. My mom says it's okay that I stay overnight at your dorm...It'll be nice to see you in a different shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't tell you. I wear this all year round. The chicks dig it... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be strange. Having to plan "dates" and.... (suddenly unreclining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?  What's up?  WICHITA                                            ] (looking down)                                         ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's not up. Guess my mind is on the end of camp and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...Serves us right after these last weeks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ] (attempted smile)                                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Serves us right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon, beard larger than ever, is familiarly sifting thr Wichita and Wendy's respective Journals. The pages are ba of new writing. He eventually clings up some of the campe journals as well. Blank as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much was happening, so quickly, no time to process it for both witnesses and participants. The journals, so often packed with scribbled spiritual groping, were now completely blank.  Constant activity, be it archery or fucking, without introspection is dangerous. It causes a brain clot, even worse a clotting of the soul. Bleeding Squaw had gone Koyaanisquatsi...out- of-balance, but then, if you've ever been to a summer camp, you know how matters most astonishing, tragic, and wondrous are not worked out until the very last day. Gravely rising, Oberon clumps the diaries into his arms a kicks dirt over the campfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very different Wendy--tougher, older, not quite wiser-- dutifully raises, while smoking a cigarette, a ragged fla marked 40. A pack of campers can only-very-briefly be see making a wild Lord of the Flies run in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MESS HALL is a mess. Loud and dirty with a black eye or two, the campers race around from table to table in rhythmic chaos.  Boys and girls eat together--some of the on the floor.  The counselors are too ethereally de-energ to do anything actively disciplinary.

dialogues.speaker: BY TALIA'S TABLE
dialogues.text: In perfect syncopation, the Bombshellettes, with a simila coiffed Vanessa musketeered between them, saunter across the mess hall. A much more bohemian Hayley passes by the trio. The two ex-friends do not even acknowledge each oth enough to ignore each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayley brakes before the uncharacteristically counseling counselor Talia, who is surprisingly holding court with a group of awed campers. Talia is almost unrecognizably unbrittle and earth motheresque (flower in hair!). Hayley attaches a string of Arts and Crafty beads around her men OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I almost forgot about Talia. She did the most shocking thing of all: She became a camp counselor.  TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished your poem, Hayley. It rocked and I'm not just saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYLEY                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll never be as good a writer as you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ] (wryly)                                                ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point. Sit down, I want to show...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A healthier Donald, his face seemingly acne-less, has ris to present Wendy with a gorgeously ornate miniature of th camp with a micro-Wendy in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONALD                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and there's you in the middle..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Donald, it's so...so exquisite. You must have put so much work into it...You know, Donald, your face is really clearing up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONALD                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, thanks...I just want to say that knowing you has...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy looks off to see Wichita set up a chair at the fron of the cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald, I have to go check on something, but thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONALD                                             ] (glum incisiveness)                                    ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another run to the storage room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ] (feeling dirty)                                        ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--Well--It's not--I--Anyway, thanks for the, the object...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Wendy sheepishly departs, Donald removes his hand from a contemplative position on his face, revealing a comical concentrated patch of acne. A Frisbee swooshes into Donal Arts and Crafts masterpiece and clips off the flagpole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONALD'S GOONY CAMPERS                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Marsh-head!

dialogues.speaker: WICHITA
dialogues.text: is fixing the wires of the headset with surprising determination. Wendy peeps up, trying to be more suave th she is.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Wichita, I can't seem  to reach the top shelf in the storage room. Could you... WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Wendy.  WENDY  (softening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about "doing it." I just think we need to talk some things out privately before... Not registering her, Wichita bounds upon the chair and ba into the working head-set.  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this camp suck or does this camp suck?  THE CAMPERS (joyously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This camp sucks!  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried to tame us...They forced us to make their bead necklaces and run their sack races, but we rebelled!  We made our own camp!  Dazed by his would-be revolutionary fervor (and non-fervo toward her), Wendy wobbles down to the nearest seat. Next to her, Ryan, the former Golden Boy, looking like a strun out heroin addict, sleazes up to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN, THE EX-HEALTHY KID                           ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, man, you gotta hook me up. Ho-ho's, ding dongs, some Little Debbie action. My parents won't send me the shit. You hear what I'm saying, they're sending me pears, for chrissakes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off--I warned you about too much, too fast. Now get out of my face... Wichita continues to weave the crowd, really getting into his increasingly malevolently modulated speechifying.  WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't leave this attitude in your sleeping bag. Take it with you back to so-called society--to your parents, your teachers, to anybody who tries to give you shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pixel crouches beside Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, what's with loverboy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pixel...he's been strange these last couple of days. I feel him pulling back...Maybe it's my imagination-- I know he loves me--It's just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet...a plan is forming. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pixel tugs Wendy away. Wendy makes momentary eye-contact with Wichita, who turns and roars to a finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one activity you need to do before tonight's big dance! Anything you want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLDER ADAM CABIN CAMPER                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's what we've doing for the past week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, give you little bastards your freedom and this is how you repay me?  Okay, let's all hit the beach; I'll figure out something relatively mind-blowing when we get there. "Move it!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camp bustles upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campers and counselors plow out the cafeteria doors. An exiting Wichita gives a glance to the side where Jasper i finishing a heart-to-heart with Dorothy, the crush girl. He pats her on the back, then rises up to join Wichita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go? You didn't tell her you were...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's not very inventive. (in deep romantic voice)                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You're obviously a very desirable young woman, but Dorothy, if I took advantage of you at this point in your life...dot-dot-dot." WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good. Oh God, look at Jerry Rice over there.  The counselors approach Todd, who is tossing a football i the air and then bobbling it to the ground.  JASPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a little harsh on Todd. You're a little harsh on everybody. I know you like to think of yourself as the Anti-Oberon, but man, you're getting just as spooky. What was that speech in there?  Does Camp really have to be a revolutionary act?  Can't the children, at their own pace, discover...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, I was a little out of hand, but come on, you got to give me Todd.  Don't get me wrong, I've learned to love the little Piggy, but Todd is the most invincible loser I've ever come across. His greatest talent is lack thereof. No matter what the category, bet against him and win. JASPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, stop...I'm willing to put my mouth where my mouth is...I throw one overhand pass and Todd catches it-- dramatic pause--You let me go down on you... WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?!  What's in it for me?  JASPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot. Seriously though, by winning this bet, you will prove  to the world that you indeed know everything.  Isn't the rush of gambling on your cynical philosophy of life enough?  WICHITA                                            ] (beat)                                                 ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is. But let's throw in you having to write the camper evaluations for the entire cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...Deal. WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Jasper, this handshake is as hot as it's going to get.  Post-handshake, Jasper takes the ball from Todd, who wadd ahead fifteen feet. Jasper cocks back to pass.  JASPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back for a pass, Todd. I know you can catch it, buddy.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Jasper.  WICHITA (deliciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd. Don't drop it.  In slow motion, Jasper arcs a perfect pass right toward Todd's chest. The ball semi-comically hangs in the air forever. The surrounding campers turn to watch with gapin mouths. Jasper rips out a piece of dental floss and confidentially brings it up to his mouth. Wichita has a flicker of doubt. Going back to regular speed, Todd drops the ball, then sh out, adorably hapless.  TODD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh--Almost! JASPER (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, "almost," you fat fuck.  Wichita cackles and struts off, picking up the discarded football. Jasper sighs. Suddenly, AN AMIABLY UNGORGEOUS C sidles up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hi, Charlie. Excellent Eggs Benedict this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COOK                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. I know I'm just the Camp Cook and I know I'm not all smoldering like that Wichita. But, for what it's worth, I'm gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you wait until the last day of camp to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COOK                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you wouldn't be interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 days without--Let me see your teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita rounds the outside of the mess hall, tossing the football to himself, humming. He gets a glimpse of Wendy and Pixel in heated discussion around the corner. Wichita recoils back, letting the football drop to the ground.  PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go through it again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so silly, Pixel. PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know if Wichita's love is true. I can think of nothing less silly. I approach Wichita at the beach, tell him he needs to go to the woods... WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll never work... Pressed against the brick around the corner, a lip-biting Wichita eavesdrops, absolutely enthralled.  PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be hiding behind a tree.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The oak where Jocelyn sprained her ankle.  PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. When we get into the clearing, I'll turn on my sexy moves. Wichita will go for it or he'll shoot me down.  Either way, you come away with knowledge.  WENDY                                              ] (resigned sigh)                                        ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the sound of their retreating footsteps, Wichita exhal a tickled chuckle. Strangely though, his beaming face deteriorates into a rock-hard-serious expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on the beach, Wichita has maintained his eerie, stone faced expression as the camp merrily gallivants aro him. Pixel's shadow envelopes him. PIXEL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita--the Thomas Twins are missing.  Somebody said they saw them run into the forest. Can you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In alluring bathing suitage, face scrunched in mock-conce Pixel leads Wichita through the forest. She stops in a clearing for some borderline bad acting.  PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm...I wonder where those two rascals could be... Wichita gives a glance to a nearby massive Oak.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE OAK
dialogues.text: Wendy eeks around the back to see Wichita move closer to Pixel, who is nastily fingering her bathing suit straps.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that were in the middle of nowhere, aren't you a little curious to know what it'd be like to... Wichita abruptly yanks Pixel into a passionately passionl kiss. His eyes are wide open. So are Pixel's. She watches Wendy quiver out from around the tree in shock. WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No...You...you...God damn you! Wichita tears Pixel away with a cold stare. He closes his eyes, swallows hard, then turns to see Wendy bolt away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counselors and campers continue to cut an idyllic ima on the beach, playing, splashing, relaxing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new, laid-back Adam lazily catches some rays, reading some gooey Women-are-from-Venus self-help book. Pixel scampers up in a breathless delirium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been, babe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this--the empire is crumbling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weeping Wendy tears into the Beach Party postcard, stop at the water's edge. Wichita storms up behind her. Frisbe drop. Sandcastles collapse. The camp extinguishes their beach blanket bingo to watch their model of romantic love rupture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy--I'm sorry--Wend--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you--how could--I gave you ever-y-thing!  I gave you parts of myself I never even knew I had!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy, I never meant to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy connects with a savage punch to Wichita's stomach t leaves him and the rest of the beach gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is revealed in the bushes at the back of the beach, watch through binoculars. He swings his viewpoint from the Wend Wichita fight to a small canoe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaware of the goings-on sandside, Tracy, the epileptic g has her arms around Two Best Buddies, belting out a silly song, while standing on a canoe. She starts to vibrate in a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oberon lowers his binoculars and howls. Wichita and Wendy truce their war to take notice of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Chief Oberon has awakened. What is he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look, that girl you got on your payroll is doing her seizure act again... The expression on Wichita's face tells the viewer what is already known. That this is no act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracey falls. Her head bashes against the side of the boa on the way down into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wichita instantly breaks from his stupor and lightnings i the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the counselors charge onto the pier. Wichita aches Tracy the epileptic girl's body up out of the water Talia cuts in before an impressed African-American SuperCounselor and takes over with paramedic poise. Mouth to mouthing. Shaking Tracy awake.  TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, can you hear me?  Okay good, that's it, that's right, cough it out.  We're going to the infirmary, honey... Tracy coughs to consciousness. Talia hefts Tracy up and hustles her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is still in the water in his clothes, utterly unnerved. H sinks below the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counselors watch Epileptic Tracy being carried away i the forest. Wendy rumbles...then erupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see...We've been selfishly clawing for any thrill we can get with a reckless, putrid disregard to safety and morality and...and now we are being punished!  Rightfully punished!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Epileptic Girls should always wear life preservers. End of story. Let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area before the cabins has been done up with cheesy hanging lights. A vicious rocker pounds from a crappy ste system worked by Donald. The Upper and Lower Income Latin Boys from the opening are doing an intense lip-sync, shar a mike before the wildly-badly dancing crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talia and Hayley are crashed on some cabin steps. They ar silent and a little sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYLEY                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you were my Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you mean to say: attractive, glamorous, older sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They softly, sweetly titter. Fanning herself, a sweaty Pi huffs up from the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talia, get away from her, I told you, Hayley's my favorite-- TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine! HAYLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys have been so colossal... PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget, when you get home, O.B.'s. They're created by a female gynecologist. TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, an insane female gynecologist! Hayley, don't listen to her. PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're the easiest to shoplift, okay?  No woman should have to pay for something forced-on-her-without- choice by Nature...what's the matter, Hayley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they playfully bicker, Hayley gazes, with a tinge of longing, to Vanessa and the Bombshellettes parked at a pi table, flirting up a storm with their cute-boy-counterpar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think--it's the Last Night of Camp Dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?  She doesn't need some boy to validate her summer experience!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh of course she does, you dumb bitch.  Just because we're feminist, doesn't mean we have to be totally abnormal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayley back me up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYLEY                                             ] (sheepish)                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One dance would be kind of nice...Don't hate me, Pixel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ] (smiling)                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. Now go away, Talia and I need to huddle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Briefly lowering the musique, Donald takes the microphone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONALD                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked for it. You're scared of it.  You got it--the last slow dance of the summer--in ten minutes. You have been warned. Act accordingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The campers stop and shudder as if hit with an electromagnetic pulse. They gulp and move toward one anot as Donald cranks back up with a happy tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking and feeling unfestive, Wichita enters the arena. His eyes rove over the Last Dance ambiance. The African- American SuperCounselor and her big Stoner Lug beau strol by, touchingly holding hands, with matching paper mache roses. Adam sidles beside Wichita for contemplation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a load of those two. Still in the kissy-hand holdy stage. Pretty pathetic, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ] (wistful beat)                                         ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...Have you seen Wendy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slam-cut away from the dance, into the kitchen. Wendy,  in an eerie black turtleneck, pounds a vast scattering of multi-colored tablets into dust with a meat tenderizer. S sweeps the chemical powder into the familiar thermos.

dialogues.text: The campers continue to adorably-awkwardly couple up. Pix and Talia look on like Wall Street brokers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, you're right, that's a good match. Pam never speaks and Martin can't shut up. Hurry, what about Hayley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.text: I don't know, I don't know, Hayley seems to get along with Simon...

dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]
