dialogues.text: The Christian kid who wants to lead advertiser boycotts when he grows up...Oh please, somebody a little more jalapeno than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you said find someone for Hayley, you did mean "dancing," right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, but it wouldn't hurt for her to feel something small and firm rub up against her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Pixel...How about bedwetter Ted?  Good-looking. Clever. And it'll be my insurance that they don't end up in the sack together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIXEL                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, nice, Hayley is always looking at Ted and she's too cool to tease about the urine thing. Let's work it. We'll each tell one that the other thinks they're cute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go--Oh, and I know who's perfect for Darlene...

dialogues.text: Taking to the crowd, Talia and Pixel burst from each othe revealing behind them: Adam leading one of his campers through a practice slow dance with Bob Dole grace as othe Adam-Campers study from the side.

dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow dance is a light moving hug. Don't force anything. Be her shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam glances to Jasper, who raises up a cup in a "toast" motion.  Adam tries to glower, but half-smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sips his cup and turns to Caleb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just going to say no. Or laugh. What was it like the first time you asked a girl to slow-dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.text: I'll have to get back to you on that one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB                                              ]

dialogues.text: I really feel I can talk to you. My parents never give answers to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.text: Parents don't give answers; they just ask questions about your questions...Caleb, you're a good guy.  Dorothy's going to like you.

dialogues.text: Jasper watches Caleb head to Crush-Girl Dorothy. Jasper t to his other side where Andrew cheekily sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.text: ANDREW                                             ]

dialogues.text: Is that an invitation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ] (out-Jaspered)                                         ]

dialogues.text: No. It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls dance together. Why can't guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JASPER                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually they can. But not...uh, I have to go check on the next song...

dialogues.text: The bespectacled Donaldish Cosmo is dancing with his rendezvous partner. He gives Donald a salute, which the counselor sadly returns. Suddenly, wordlessly, the darkly garbed Wendy appears and pulls Donald out onto the dance floor dirt.

dialogues.text: A STRING OF CAMPER FACES continue the same sentence.  DANCING FEMALE CAMPER ONE

dialogues.text: to tell me that you--  DANCING MALE CAMPER TWO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: liked me.

dialogues.text: Bedwetter Ted and Hayley drift, quite relaxed in each oth arms. The red-capped Teaser from his cabin shouts out, wh dancing with Vanessa.

dialogues.text: Hey Bedwetter Ted, too bad your dry spell's over. I hope you remembered your diaper, dude.

dialogues.text: Losing a smile, Adam focuses upon the Red-capped jerk wit a look of death. The viewer curls to Adam's dance partner Pixel.  Pixel's eyes float down the backside of Wendy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy's partner, Donald, floats on air, his face beaming out of control. The viewer's viewpoint twists around to t stony of expression of Wendy. She is, in turn, glaring ou to Wichita and Talia dancing together.

dialogues.text: Wichita and Talia feel the chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Br-r-r. Nice show at the beach this afternoon. What's this little tift about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. You know I'm still pissed off...I thought this summer we would really get to know each other more than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did, Talia. One way or the other. Did you get into Livingston's class next semester?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALIA                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You too?  When we get back to the city, we should... (looking off)                                          ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, there goes Amber again. I gotta go be a counselor...

dialogues.text: Talia rushes off. "Kumbaya" ends and is replaced by a rob punk ditty. The couples go into tribal writhing. The abandoned Wichita's attention is pulled to the sight  of Eric planting his dance partner on a chair. With queas awareness, Wichita watches Eric give her an "I'll be righ back" gesture.  The mentor's eyes follow the protoge to t punch bowl where Eric flirts with some other girls.  Wichita scans back to Eric's dance partner beginning to f restless and unwanted. After a squirming beat, Eric final neck-touches the Girl from behind. Wichita sadly realizes just as the viewer does, that he has taught Eric well. Da Wendy breaks Wichita's concentration, clutching a lantern and the fateful thermos.  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: DONALD
dialogues.text: sees Wichita and Wendy vanish into the woods.  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are they... ADAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think?  The woods.  Tender goodbyes and what-have-you.  DONALD                                             ]

dialogues.text: What about the fight on the beach... PIXEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll help you get the ponies back in the stables. Okay campers, party's over..! Adam pounds off the music. The campers let off an en-mass groan as Adam lemmings them back to their cabins.  GENERIC DANCING CAMPER                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM                                               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among other things...Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AFRICAN-AMERICAN COMPETENT COUNSELOR               ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald, we don't want to leave you alone with all the campers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG STONER LUG                                     ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONALD                                             ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here you two crazy kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald sweetly smiles as they scamper through the trees. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Jasper, my one and only homosexual friend, it looks like it's just you and me tonight.  Donald turns around to see Jasper approaching, holding ha with the Cook, who is holding a lantern.  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cook?  Charlie, the cook?  JASPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh. (Nathan Lane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the only thing on the menu I'm allowed to eat.  COOK (good-natured laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, girlfriend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a Moses pose atop the MESS HALL roof, Oberon looks out to a constellation of beaming lanterns scattering over th dark expanse of forest each representing a trysting coupl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many lanterns...Too much, too quickly...The organism needed a major readjustment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucking a cigarette, Wendy puts the lantern and the therm in the crevice of a large rock. She sulks to the side of the creek as Wichita nervously skips rocks across the wat WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, our last night at camp...I always knew it would be something special.  WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?  WENDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something more interesting than that...How could you?  How could--! WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!  Stop it, this afternoon was not what you thought...I overheard you and Pixel, at the side of the mess hall, your idea about the "test"...Do you believe me?  WENDY (devastated shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iunno.  (quiet strength)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I believe you. It's so  you...I didn't think it was possible for you to make me feel worse, but...you're saying you deliberately destroyed us!  I don't even get I'm- sorry-it-was-the-heat-of-the- moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm...I'm evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's right, baby, you're so "evil." You're, you're so "dark"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WICHITA                                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WENDY                                              ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not evil or dark...you're just scared. WICHITA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck--! Wichita spins, hurling a rock with unconscious rage. It shatters the lantern sending the ex-couple into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE BUS ONE
dialogues.text: In one sweeping gesture, Adam twists out and yanks the Computer Image T-shirt Boy inside. The doors close instantaneously behind and the bus roars away. Wendy runs up beside it, but can't catch up. She turns to the other bus with dread as Wichita can be seen clambering inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bombshellettes giggle together in one of the front se Behind them, Hayley and Vanessa sit side-by-side in compl silence. Words are not necessary to show how wide the cha between them has become.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them a couple rows, Eric hands the ex-Golden Boy a Pink Snowball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN, EX-GOLDEN BOY                                ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day. Another dollar. Literally.  I think I'll cash this and buy myself a...pizza.  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we didn't do this for the money, we did it for...help me out... All eyes turn to a head-down Wendy thudding up the bus st and clumping down the aisle. The viewer can quickly disce that the only open seat is next to a lone, brooding Wichi but Wendy is in denial. She shuffles all the way to the b of the bus before retreating forward.  OBERON NARRATION (V.O.)                            ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it continues to feel good, the young are not going to stop taking drugs, getting drunk, having sex, and watching crap media.  Even a parody of a grown-up like me knows they're will never be a return to old-fashioned values--But that doesn't mean we won't get some new fashioned ones. Coming of age in the 21st century is less about the loss of innocence, then the finding of it. Wendy, Wichita, Talia, Adam, Jasper, Pixel, and Donald Dark were reborn this summer. And it hurt. And that's good. As if the seat were covered with needles, Wendy descends next to Wichita. The bus immediately begins to lumber forward. The ex-lovers stare straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CAMP
dialogues.text: Oberon watches the buses rumble away. He clicks off his stopwatch.  OBERON (V.O.)                                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You'll learn the true meaning of responsibility, while creating memories that last a lifetime." The workbooklet is not bullshitting. It's just pretty fucking sketchy on the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning to the zombie tableau of Wichita and Wendy, would be cheerer-upper Donald wobbles up with his camera.  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I'm sorry, I refuse to go out with this doom-and-gloom. I'm getting a picture from you complex individuals.  Hold on, let's get  a kid in here... Not really taking his eyes away from the camera, Donald latches a child's arm in the aisle. With a shudder of fea Donald realizes he has grabbed Don't-Touch-Me Todd. Donal cringes for a scream, but Todd calmly curls into a seated position between the caught off-guard Wendy and Wichita.  DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now stop pretending you didn't have any good times...Shooting stars. Frogs down pants. Surely, at some point, one of us watched a baby deer being born. Come on...Smi-ile.  The members of the trio drift their heads forward. Look ahead.  Look down. Look around.  OBERON (V.O.)                                      ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, our tale is supposed to have a happy ending. Okay, this may not be happy, but look on the bright side, it's not an ending either. Life is a lot like death, it happens to everyone whether they like it or not. It's going to be beautiful-ugly, exciting-boring, endless-abrupt-- So go ahead, smile. God bless my counselors and campers, in a small but significant forest- in-the-middle-of-Oregon way, they tried to destroy the cliches of growing up and come up with some better ones.  Let's not get uptight over their ultimate failure...I mean, there's always next summer. Wichita, Wendy, and Don't Touch-Me-Todd all momentarily c their heads up and form a valiant, bittersweet smile.  Donald snaps. The image freezes into a photograph.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE CENTER OF CAMP--A DAY NEXT SUMMER
dialogues.text: Instantly multiplied, the photograph is now the cover pic of the new Camp Workbooklet. NEXT YEAR'S SET OF COUNSELOR in their uniforms, are seated atop the center-of-camp roc pretending to read the silly tome. Oberon's loudspeaker v crackles in the air, pretty much ignored.

dialogues.text: The counselors both suddenly turn, along with the viewer, to the sight of the bus doors opening.

dialogues.speaker: THE FILM GOES TO BLACK
dialogues.text: And after a beat of silence, a bold, full version of "Oh, my Unforgettable Summer Love" completely takes over.
